The primary course of action is to take medicine to cut it off. If there is swelling along the spine, it is hopeless.[39p]

　　　　　莲子发

　　莲子发生于右胛中，外如莲房，内有子孔，恐其毒奔入心，大要用托里散，加芩，连、黄蘗、荷盖散之，不令攻心，渐消可治。通背肿者，危。
　　　　　脾发

　　脾发生于左膊间，初起可用灯火点破，内服追疔汤，汗之即散。
　　　　　蜂窝发

　　蜂窝发正当脊心，形如蜂窝，有孔在上者不宜，最为反证，宜托里散加菊花，生肌定痛，防毒攻心。难治，因心火未发故也。
　　　　　对心发[40p]

Lotus Seed Eruption

The lotus seed erupts in the right shoulder; it appears like a lotus pod, with a central opening. There is a fear that its poison may rush into the heart. Generally, one should use the Tuo Li San, combined with Huang Qin, Lian, Huang Bo, and He Gai San, to avoid attacking the heart, allowing it to gradually dissipate and become treatable. If there is swelling in the back, it is dangerous.

Spleen Eruption

The spleen eruption occurs between the left arms. At the onset, it can be broken with a flame; internally, use Chui Ding Decoction. Sweating will disperse it.

Honeycomb Eruption

The honeycomb eruption typically occurs along the spine; it resembles a honeycomb. Those with openings at the top are particularly unfavorable and serve as counter-indications. Tuo Li San with chrysanthemum should be used to promote flesh regeneration and alleviate pain, preventing the poison from attacking the heart. It is difficult to treat because the heart fire has yet to arise.

Heart-facing Eruption[40p]

　　对心发极重，因心火盛而热气会注于此。其毒壮盛走暴，急用疏导心火之药解之。
　　　　　流注发

　　散走流注发，毒气乘风热而走，急宜疏风定热治之，则气自息。若流注于手脚腿者，必死无疑。
　　　　　龟形发

　　此发头尾俱尖，四边散大，如龟之形，因饮食所至，而气食相关，合阴虚而成之。气虚而散者，所以开口而阔，急服托里补气药。
　　　　薛氏医案 【明□薛己】

　　　　　灸法用药

　　《精要》曰：经云，诸痛痒疮疡皆属心火。前辈又谓，痈疽多生于丹石房劳之人。凡人生四十以上，生发背等疮，宜安心早治。此证如虎入室，御而不善，必至伤人，宜先用内托散，次用连翘五香汤，更以骑竹马法，或隔蒜灸并明灸足三里，以发泄其毒。盖邪之所凑，其气必虚；留而不去，其病乃实。故痈疽未溃，脏腑蓄毒，一毫热药，断不可用。痈疽已溃，脏腑既亏，一毫冷药，亦不可用。犹宜忌用敷贴之药，闭其毫孔。[41p]

Severe heart disturbances arise from an excess of heart fire, leading to concentrated heat in this area. The toxicity becomes intense and aggressive, necessitating the urgent use of remedies to clear the heart fire.

Flowing Disturbance
Flowing disturbances disperse and escape; poisonous vapors ride the wind and heat, so it is crucial to disperse the wind and calm the heat for treatment, allowing the energy to stabilize. If this disturbance occurs in the hands, feet, or legs, death is inevitable.

Turtle Shape Disturbance
This disturbance has both ends pointed, with the sides spreading out widely, resembling the shape of a turtle. It arises from dietary issues, linked to the energy and food intake, coupled with yin deficiency. The energy disperses due to weakness, leading to an open and wide mouth; urgent use of remedies to support energy is needed.

Xue's Medical Case
The moxibustion method and medications:
The "Essentials" states: The classics say all pain, itching, sores, and lesions belong to heart fire. Previous practitioners noted that carbuncles and abscesses often occur in those who labor heavily in the stone industry. For anyone over the age of forty who develops sores on their back or elsewhere, it is advisable to calm the heart and seek early treatment. These symptoms are like a tiger entering a home; if handled poorly, they will harm the person. First, use internal remedies to disperse toxicity, followed by Lianqiao Wuxiang Decoction, and additionally use the method of moxibustion on the foot Sanli point, or moxibustion with garlic to expel the toxins. The presence of evil causes energy deficiency; if left unattended, the illness becomes severe. Therefore, if carbuncles or abscesses have not burst, internal organs are still harboring toxins, and not even a bit of heat-inducing medicine should be used. If the carbuncles or abscesses have burst, and the internal organs are already depleted, not even a bit of cold medicine should be used. It is also important to avoid plasters that may close up the pores.[41p]

若热渴便秘，脉沉实洪数，宜用大黄等药以泻其毒，后用国老膏、万金散、黄矾丸、远志酒之类，选而用之。　　按前证若热毒蕴于内，大便秘结，元气无亏者，宜用大黄等药泄其热毒。若阴亏阳凑，精虚气竭，脾胃虚弱者，宜用甘温之剂，培其本源。若疮不臖肿不作脓者，虽未溃仍须温补。若疮已溃而肿不退痛不止者，仍宜清凉之剂治之。若病急而元气实者，先治其标；病缓而元气虚者，先治其本。或病急而元气更虚者，必先治本而兼以治标。[42p]

If there is heat, thirst, and constipation, with a pulse that is deep, forceful, and rapid, it is advisable to use herbs like Da Huang to purge the toxins. Afterwards, use remedies such as Guo Lao Gao, Wan Jin San, Huang Fan Wan, or Yuan Zhi Jiu, choosing as appropriate.

Note: If the symptoms indicate heat toxins accumulated internally, with constipation but no deficiency of vital energy, it is best to use Da Huang and similar medicines to expel the heat and toxins. If there is deficiency in yin with an excess of yang, leading to insufficient essence and depleted qi, and weak spleen and stomach, warming tonics should be used to replenish the source.

If sores are not ulcerated or swollen but not festering, they still require warming and tonifying. If sores have already ulcerated, with swelling that persists and pain that does not stop, cooling remedies should still be applied.

In cases of acute illness with sufficient vital energy, treat the symptoms first; in cases of chronic illness with deficient vital energy, treat the root cause first. If the illness is acute and vital energy is even more deficient, it is essential to treat the root cause first while also managing the symptoms.[42p]

大抵肿高臖痛，脓水稠粘者，元气未损也，治之则易；漫肿微痛，脓水清稀者，元气虚弱也，治之则难；不肿不痛，或漫肿色黯不溃者，发于阴也，元气虚甚，理所不治。若肿高臖痛者，先用仙方活命饮，后用托里消毒散。漫肿微痛者，宜托里散，如不应，加姜、桂。若脓出而反痛，气血虚也，八珍散。不作脓，不腐溃，阳气虚也，四君加归、芪、肉桂。不生肌，不收敛，脾气虚也，十全大补加姜，桂。晡热内热，阴血虚也，四物加参、朮。欲呕作呕，胃气虚也，六君加炮姜。自汗盗汗，五脏虚也，六味丸加五味子。[43p]

Generally, if there is swelling, pain, and thick, sticky pus, the vital energy is not damaged, and treatment is easy; if there is diffuse swelling, slight pain, and clear, thin pus, the vital energy is weak, and treatment is difficult; if there is no swelling or pain, or if there is diffuse swelling that is dark in color and unrelieved, it arises from Yin, and the vital energy is severely deficient, thus it should not be treated.

If there is swelling, pain, and high elevation, first use the Xianfang Huo Ming Decoction, then use the Tuo Li Xiao Du Powder. For diffuse swelling and slight pain, it is advisable to use the Tuo Li Powder; if there is no response, add ginger and cinnamon. If pus is discharged but there is pain, it indicates deficiency of Qi and blood, use the Ba Zhen Powder. If there is no pus, no necrosis, it indicates deficient Yang Qi, use Si Jun Powder plus Gui, Qi, and cinnamon. If there is no generation of flesh, no retraction, it indicates deficient spleen Qi, use the Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction plus ginger and cinnamon. If there is fever in the afternoon and internal heat, it indicates deficiency of Yin blood, use Si Wu Decoction plus ginseng and Atractylodes. If there is a desire to vomit or actual vomiting, it indicates deficient stomach Qi, use the Liu Jun Decoction plus roasted ginger. If there is spontaneous sweating or night sweats, it indicates deficiency of the five organs, use the Liu Wei Wan plus Schisandra.[43p]

食少体倦，脾气虚也，补中益气加茯苓、半夏。喘促咳嗽，脾肺虚也，前汤加麦门、五味。欲呕少食，脾胃虚也，人参理中汤。腹痛泄泻，脾胃虚寒也，附子理中汤。小腹痞，足胫肿，脾肾虚弱也，十全大补汤加山萸、山药、肉桂。泄泻足冷，脾肾虚弱也，前药加桂、附。热渴淋闭，肾虚阴火也，加减八味丸。喘嗽淋闭，肺肾虚火也，补中益气汤、加减八味丸。凡此变证，皆因元气亏损，失于预补所致。故丹溪先生云：但见肿痛，参之脉证虚弱，便与滋补，气血无亏，可保终吉。旨哉斯言！盖古今虚实不同，因时施治，不无少异。[44p]

When there is little food intake and physical weakness, it indicates a deficiency of the spleen and qi. One should use "Buzhong Yiqi Decoction" and add Poria and Pinellia. If there are symptoms of wheezing and coughing, it indicates deficiency of the spleen and lungs. In this case, one adds wheat and five-flavor fruit to the previous decoction. For nausea and reduced appetite, it indicates deficiency of the spleen and stomach, thus "Ren Shen Li Zhong Decoction" should be used. For abdominal pain and diarrhea, indicating cold deficiency of the spleen and stomach, use "Fu Zi Li Zhong Decoction." For distension in the lower abdomen and swelling in the lower legs, indicating weakness of the spleen and kidneys, use "Shiquan Dabu Decoction" with additions of spiny date, yam, and cinnamon. For diarrhea with cold feet, also indicating weakness of the spleen and kidneys, add cinnamon and aconite to the previous medicine. For thirst accompanied by heat and urinary difficulty, it indicates kidney yin deficiency fire; one should use the modified "Eight Flavors Pill." For wheezing and urinary difficulty, indicating deficiency fire of the lungs and kidneys, use "Buzhong Yiqi Decoction" combined with the modified "Eight Flavors Pill." All these variations are caused by depletion of the vital energy, a result of inadequate preemptive supplementation. Therefore, Master Danxi stated: "Whenever one sees swelling and pain, and the pulse indicates weakness, one should supplement; if there is no deficiency of qi and blood, one can ensure a good outcome." This statement is profound! It is essential to adapt treatments to the differing conditions of deficiency and excess throughout history and apply treatments according to the times, which can lead to slight differences.[44p]

　　　　　论调护法

　　李氏云：背疽之方虽多，得效者殊少。今择用验者录之，庶不致悞人。如护心散，凡有疽疾，早进数服，使毒气外出而无呕吐之患，否则咽喉口舌生疮，或黑烂如菌。若疮发四五日之后，宜间用别药治之。　　按护心散乃解金石发疽之药，若发热臖肿，作渴饮冷而呕者，宜用。若发热臖肿，作渴饮汤而呕者，不宜用。若脾虚停痰，或寒邪内侵，或痛伤脾胃，宜用六君子汤。若喉舌生疮，口干作喝，或小便频数，宜用六味丸。[45p]

Discussion on Protecting and Treating Illnesses

大凡诸疮作呕，若饮冷便秘，是热毒也，黄连消毒散解之；饮冷便和，是胃火也，竹叶石膏汤清之；懒食饮汤，是胃虚也，补中益气汤以补之；大便不实，喜饮热汤，是脾胃虚寒也，六君加炮姜以温之。常见脾胃虚弱者，用前药反心间阴冷，无不致呕。其喉舌生疮，乃肾水枯涸，虚火炎上，其证甚恶，急用加减八味丸，亦有得生者。　　背疽多先渴而后发，或先疽而后渴，不救多矣。若服加减八味丸，非特杜绝渴疾，抑且大滋气血，生长肌肉。[46p]

In general, if one has sores and feels nauseous, or if drinking cold leads to constipation, it is due to heat poison, which can be resolved with Huanglian Xiaodu San. If drinking cold results in a balanced condition, it indicates stomach fire, treatable with Zhuye Shigao Tang to clear it. For back sores (abscesses), thirst often appears before and sometimes after the sores, and neglecting it is perilous. Taking the modified Bamei Wan not only alleviates thirst but also greatly nourishes qi and blood, promoting muscle growth.[46p]

　　　　疽源有五

　　一天行；二瘦弱气滞；三怒气；四肾气虚；五饮冷酒食炙煿，服丹药。　　按前证所因虽殊，其治法亦当审别经络，阴阳虚实，表里肿溃，而以助胃壮气为主，使根本坚固，庶保无虞。
　　　　　生死形证

　　问曰：病有甚而至生，有微而至死，病证难辨死生，何从决乎？答曰：发背溃透内膜者死，此言肝俞已上也。未溃内陷，面青唇黑，便污者死，此言脏坏便瘀血也。按前证有因元气虚弱而毒气内陷者，有因初作失于内疏托里和荣卫者，有因毒盛失于消解者，有因虚弱失于补托者，有因脓成失于针刺者，有因腐溃失于补养者。若发背属湿热上壅者，黄连消毒散、补中益气汤，以除湿毒，补脾肺，滋肾水。[47p]

Sources of Boils

  1. External factors;
  2. Weakness and stagnation of energy;
  3. Anger;
  4. Kidney energy deficiency;
  5. Consumption of cold drinks, hot foods, and pills.

Although the causes of the aforementioned conditions vary, the treatment methods should also carefully distinguish between the meridians, the deficiencies and excesses of yin and yang, as well as external and internal swelling and ulceration. The primary goal is to support the stomach and strengthen energy to ensure a solid foundation, thereby safeguarding against potential risks.

Life and Death Signs

Question: Some illnesses are severe and lead to death, while others are mild yet still result in death. How can one differentiate between conditions that indicate life or death?

Answer: If there is an abscess on the back that penetrates the internal membrane, it is a sign of death; this refers to the area above the liver. If there is yet no penetration but the face turns blue and the lips black, with dark stool, it indicates death; this refers to organ deterioration with stagnant blood.

There are various causes for the conditions mentioned, including weakness of the original qi leading to internal toxicity, initial manifestations that fail to promote internal harmony, excessive toxicity that fails to dissipate, weakness that fails to be replenished, formation of pus that fails to be drained, and corruption leading to failure in nourishment. If the abscesses are due to damp-heat obstruction, the use of Huanglian Jiedu San and Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang is advised to eliminate dampness and toxins, bolster the spleen and lungs, and nourish the water of the kidneys.[47p]

　　　　　麦饭石膏治效

　　李氏云：麦饭石膏，治发背痈疽，神妙，惜世罕知。有患者因脓不溃，以毒药罨之，其势益甚，毒延咽喉脚膝，皆为不治。余用此膏，一夕顿溃。凡疽得脓，其毒始解。或有不溃者，须用此膏。故录之，俾精择修合，以收十全之功也。　　按前证属腑属阳而气血未损者，用前膏敷之，固无不愈，然亦有属脏属阴而气血有亏者，当审其因而调治其内可也。大凡疮疡之作，由胃气不从；疮疡之溃，由胃气腐化；疮疡之敛，由胃气营养。余尝治初结成肿者，托而散之；已成欲作脓者，托而腐之；脓成未溃者，托而开之；脓已溃者，托而敛之。东垣先生云：胃气乃生发之源，为人身之本。丹溪先生亦谓：治疮当助胃壮气，使根本坚固。厥言旨哉！[48p]

There was a patient whose pus did not rupture; after applying a toxic medicine, the condition worsened, and the poison spread to the throat and knees, resulting in an untreatable state. Thus, I record it to allow for careful selection and adjustment, aiming for complete success.

Moreover, in cases where the symptoms belong to the yang and the qi and blood are not harmed, applying this plaster will surely lead to healing. However, for cases that belong to the yin and show deficiency in qi and blood, one must carefully assess the cause and adjust the internal condition accordingly. Generally, the formation of sores and ulcers arises from improper gastric qi; the rupture of sores and ulcers stems from the corruption of gastric qi; the healing of sores and ulcers depends on the nourishment of gastric qi. I have treated initial swellings by dispersing them; those on the verge of producing pus by facilitating their decay; pus that has formed but not ruptured by encouraging its opening; and once pus has ruptured by promoting its healing. 　　　　　寒热多汗用药

　　李氏云：近有数人病背疽，或先寒后热，或先热后寒，或连日，或间日，必呕痰大汗而后止，皆用柴胡、恒山不应。余谓此因脾气不正，复感寒邪痰盛而作，遂先用不换金正气散，次用排脓内托散、木香汤，三日即愈。　　按前证若外邪既去而仍作，宜用六君子汤以补脾胃。大凡胃气虚而作呕者，必喜温；热毒内攻而作呕者，必喜寒。治当辨之。[49p]

Treatment for Cold, Heat, and Excessive Sweating

These patients must experience vomiting, phlegm, and profuse sweating before their condition improves, and both Chai Hu and Heng Shan were ineffective. Generally, if vomiting occurs due to weakened stomach energy, warmth is preferred; if caused by internal heat and toxins, cold is favored. Treatment should be differentiated accordingly.[49p]

　　　　　发热属肾虚

　　李氏曰：一发背之热，未有不自肾虚而得之者，必须五更服加减八味丸。　　按前论诚为启发后人，垂惠永久。盖发背由肾经湿热，虚火上炎，中传恶证，若非加减八味丸，滋肾水以制心火，补中益气以生化源，欲望其生难矣。启元子云：大寒而甚，热之不热，是无火也，当助其心。大热而甚，寒之不寒是无水也，当益其肾。夫寒之不寒，责其无水；热之不热，责其无火；热之不久，责心之虚；寒之不久，责水之少。窃谓无火者，当用八味丸以益其心；无水者，当用六味丸以滋其肾。　　又按《肘后》用冬瓜切去一头，合疮上，瓜烂复切合之。若臖肿痛甚，其邪在表者，最宜用此法宣热拔毒，以通其滞。若肿痛发渴，大便秘结，其邪在里者，须佐以内疏黄连汤，通利脏腑以泄其毒；在经络者，当助以托里荣卫汤，以调气血，斯善。[50p]

　　　　　分别三因

　　陈无择云：发背者，该三因而有之。论曰：痈疽瘰疬，不问虚实寒热，皆由气郁而成。经亦云：气宿于经络，与血俱濇而不行，壅结为痈疽。不言热之所作而后成痈者，此乃内因喜怒忧思有所郁而成也。身有热，被风冷搏之，血脉凝泣不行，热气壅结而成；亦有阴虚阳气凑袭，寒化为热，热成则肉腐为脓者，此亦外因寒热风湿所伤而成也。又服丹石及炙煿酒面、温床厚被所致，又尽力房室，精虚气节所致者，此乃不内外因所伤而成也。故知三因备也。　　按所分三因虽备，但未具疮疡之邪在经、在表、在里之异，故其治法，亦不得详备也。[51p]

Three Causes of Separation

Chen Wuze states: Those who develop back pain are influenced by three causes. The discussion states: boils, sores, and tuberculosis, regardless of whether they are due to deficiency or excess, cold or heat, all arise from stagnant qi. The classic text also states: qi accumulates in the meridians, thickening with blood, causing blockage that leads to boils and sores. It does not mention that heat must be present later for boils to form; rather, this is a result of internal causes such as pent-up emotions—joy, anger, worry, or thought.

When the body has heat and is struck by wind and cold, the blood vessels become congested and fail to flow, resulting in heat accumulation and blockage. There are also cases where yin deficiency and yang qi converge, causing cold to transform into heat, leading to decay of flesh into pus; this, too, arises from external causes of cold, heat, wind, or dampness.

Moreover, ingesting certain elixirs or consuming overly heated wine, using thick bedding, or exhausting oneself sexually—all of these lead to empty yang and disrupted qi’s adjustment. Hence, it is understood that the three causes are comprehensive. However, while the three causes are classified, the variations in the pathogens that affect skin, surface, or internal conditions are not distinctly outlined, therefore the treatment methods cannot be thoroughly detailed.[51p]

　　　　　背疮总论

　　发背属督脉膀胱经，凡阴虚火盛，或醇酒厚味，或郁怒房劳，或丹石热毒，皆能致之。若肿赤痛甚，脉洪数而有力者，热毒之证也，为易治。若漫肿微痛色黯作渴，脉虽洪数而无力者，阴虚之证也，为难治。若不肿不痛或漫肿色黯，脉微细者，阳气虚甚也，尤为难治。背疽之人，难于隐几。用菉菜豆十余斗，作一大袋隐伏，则自然心凉身安。　　若肿臖作痛，寒热作渴，饮食如常，此形气病气俱有余也，先用仙方活命饮，后用托里消毒散解之。　　头痛拘急，乃表证先服人参败毒散一二剂。如厥痛，用金银花散或槐花酒、神效托里散。　　臖痛肿硬脉实，以清凉饮、仙方活命饮、苦参丸。　　肿硬木闷，疼痛，发热烦躁，饮冷便秘，脉沉实者，内疏黄连汤或清凉饮。[52p]

Overview of Back Sores

Back sores are associated with the Governing Meridian and the Bladder Channel. They can arise from various causes: excess heat due to Yin deficiency, consumption of rich foods and alcohol, emotional distress, or heat toxins from minerals.

If there is significant swelling, redness, and pain, with a strong and rapid pulse, this indicates heat toxin, which is easier to treat. If there is diffuse swelling with slight pain, a dark color, and despite a rapid pulse it feels weak, this indicates Yin deficiency, which is more difficult to treat. If there is no swelling or pain, or diffuse swelling with a dark color and a weak, thin pulse, this indicates severe Yang deficiency and is particularly hard to treat.

For individuals with back sores, it is difficult to conceal the symptoms. Use about ten douts of mung bean and make a large bag to hide it, which will naturally cool the heart and calm the body.

If there is swelling and pain, accompanied by chills and fever, while appetite remains unchanged, this indicates excess of both form and spirit. Start with the Immortal Vitality Decoction, followed by the Elimination of Toxins Powder for resolution.

For headache and stiffness as a surface condition, take one or two doses of Ginseng Poison-Dispelling Powder first. For cramping pain, use Honeysuckle Powder or Sophora Flower Wine, or the effective Elimination of Toxins Powder.

For pain and hard swelling with a solid pulse, employ cooling drinks, Immortal Vitality Decoction, or Bitter Root Pills. If there is hard swelling with a wooden feeling, pain, heat, restlessness, cold drinks causing constipation, and a deep solid pulse, then use the Internal Clearing Huanglian Decoction or a cooling drink.[52p]

大便已利，欲得作脓，用仙方活命饮、托里散、蜡矾丸，外用神异膏。　　漫肿微痛，或色不赤，饮食少思，此形气病气俱不足也，用托里散补之。　　不作脓，或脓成不溃，阳气虚也，托里散倍加肉桂、参、芪。　　脓出而反痛，或脓清稀，气血俱虚也，八珍汤。　　恶寒形寒，或不收敛，阳气虚也，十全大补汤。　　晡热内热，或不收敛，阴气虚也，四物加参、朮。　　作呕欲呕，或不收敛，胃气虚也，六君加炮姜。　　食少体倦，或不收敛，脾气虚也，补中益气汤加茯苓、半夏。　　肉赤而不敛，血热也，四物加山栀、连翘。　　肉白而不敛，脾虚也，四君加酒炒芍药、木香。　　小便频数者，肾阴亏损也，加减八味丸。　　肿高臖痛脉浮者，邪在表也，托之。　　臖痛烦躁或咽干，火在上也，宜泻之。[53p]

　　肿痛或不作脓者，邪气凝结也，宜解之。　　肿痛饮冷发热睡语者，火也，宜清之。　　不作脓，或不溃及不敛者，阳气虚也，宜补之。　　瘀肉不腐，或积毒不解者，阳气虚也，宜助阳气。　　脓多或清者，气血俱虚也，宜峻补之。　　右关脉弱而肌肉迟生者，宜健脾胃。　　若初患未发出，而寒热疼痛，作渴饮冷，此邪气内蕴也，仙方活命饮。口干饮热，漫肿微痛，此元气内虚也，托里消毒散。饮食少思，肢体倦怠，脾胃虚弱也，六君子汤；如未应，加姜、桂。其有死者，乃邪气盛，真气虚，而不能发出也，在于旬余之间见之。　　若已发出，用托里消毒散。不腐溃，用托里散；如不应，急温补脾胃。其有死者，乃真气虚而不能腐溃也，在于二旬之间见之。　　若已腐溃，用托里散以生肌。如不应，急温补脾胃。[54p]

其有死者，乃脾气虚而不能收敛也，在于月余间见之。　　此三证虽不见于经籍，予尝治而历验者。　　尝治发背初起未成脓，先用乌金膏或援生膏点患处数点，以杀其大势，更服仙方活命饮。如饮食少思，或不甘美，用六君子汤加藿香，连进三五剂。如外皮腐动，用雄黄解毒散洗之，每日用乌金膏涂腐处，候有疮口，即用纸作捻，蘸乌金膏纴入疮内；若有脓为筋膜间膈不出，致作胀痛，用针引之，腐肉堵塞者去之。若瘀肉腐动，用猪蹄汤洗。如脓稠臖痛，饮食如常，瘀肉自腐，用消毒药与托里相兼服之，仍用乌金膏涂擦。若瘀肉已离好肉，即去之。如脓不稠不稀，微作痛，饮食不甘，瘀肉腐迟，用桑柴灸患处，更用托里药主治之。瘀肉不腐或脓清稀，不臖痛者，服大补之剂，仍用桑木灸之，以补接阳气，解散郁毒，其肉自腐。[55p]

　　　　医学准绳六要【 明□张三锡】
　　　　　痛因

　　看书久坐对弈而腰背痛者，属虚，补中益气汤为主，八物汤。　　肥人多痰，年高必用人捶而痛快者，属痰属虚，除湿化痰，兼补脾肾。　　醉饱后多痛欲捶，是脾不运而湿热作楚也，须节饮。瘦人多是血少阴虚，亦不禁酒及厚味而然。养血清火，四物、酒芩、连、牡丹皮。　　背痛须加羌活、防风引经，肥人少佐附子。　　有素虚人及病后产后经行后，心痛或牵引乳胁，或走注肩背，此元气上逆，当引使归元，不可复下疏刷，愈刷愈痛。发汗人患此者众，惟宜温补，拘于痛无补法之言悞矣。汗者心之液，阳受气于胸中，汗过多则心液耗，阳气不足故致痛也。[56p]

Medical Principles: Six Essentials

Pain Causes

For those who suffer from waist and back pain due to prolonged reading or sitting in games, it is associated with deficiency. The main treatment is Shenqi Decoction, along with Bawei Decoction. Overweight individuals with phlegm, particularly older ones who experience pain alleviated by hitting, are attributed to phlegm and deficiency; they should focus on eliminating dampness and phlegm while also tonifying the spleen and kidneys.

After excessive drinking or eating, if pain occurs with a desire to be hit, it is due to the spleen's inability to transport, leading to damp heat. One should regulate their diet. Slim individuals often suffer from blood deficiency and Yin deficiency, and they cannot indulge in alcohol or rich foods as a result. Nourishing blood and clearing heat can be achieved with Siwu Decoction, Jiuqing (Wine with Scutellaria), Lian, and paeonia.

For back pain, one should add Qianghuo and Fangfeng to guide treatment along the meridians; overweight individuals should minimize the use of Fuzi. Individuals with a history of deficiency, as well as those recovering from illness or childbirth, may experience heart pain or radiating pain to the sides of the chest or back. This is due to the reversal of vital energy; one must guide it back to the source and should not further relax or press, as it will lead to increased pain.

Those who sweat excessively often suffer from this condition and should focus on warm supplementation. Being bound by pain prevents effective treatment; sweat is the liquid of the heart, and if excessive, it depletes heart fluid and leads to insufficient Yang energy, resulting in pain.[56p]

　　　　　恶寒

　　背为阳，腹为阴。背恶寒。阳不足也。阳不足则阴气盛，阴气盛则口中和。阳气内陷者，口干燥。附子、白虎宜加详审。　　口中和，背恶寒者属少阴，附子汤及灸气海；阳气内陷，口干燥，背恶寒，白虎汤。

　　　　证治准绳 【明□王肯堂】

　　　　　强痛

　　脊痛项强，腰似折，项似拔，冲头痛，乃足太阳经不行也，羌活胜湿汤主之。若打扑伤损，从高坠下，恶血在太阳经中，腰脊痛不可忍，地龙汤主之。　　按《脉经》云：风寒汗出，肩背痛，中风，小便数而欠者，风热乘其肺，使肺气郁甚也，当泻风热，以通气防风汤主之。然则寒热气不足以息，而肩背痛小便遗失者，当以人参、黄芪之属，补肺气之虚，不言可知也。[57p]

Translation:

Cold-Induced Fever

Aversion to Cold

The back corresponds to Yang, and the abdomen corresponds to Yin. When there is an aversion to cold in the back, it indicates Yang deficiency. When Yang is insufficient, Yin energy becomes excessive; this results in harmony in the mouth. When Yang energy sinks inward, the mouth becomes dry. Aconite and White Tiger Decoction should be examined in detail. When there is harmony in the mouth, but an aversion to cold in the back, it belongs to the Lesser Yin; Aconite Decoction and moxibustion at Qihai (Sea of Qi) is appropriate. When Yang energy sinks inward, leading to a dry mouth and an aversion to cold in the back, White Tiger Decoction is indicated.

You should disperse the wind-heat to promote qi; Fangfeng Decoction is the main remedy. If cold and warm qi are insufficient to rest, and pain in the shoulders and back leads to loss of urination, you should supplement lung qi deficiency with ingredients such as Ginseng and Astragalus. This is self-evident.[57p]

　　　　　天柱发对心发对脐发

　　或问背发疽有几？曰：上中下三发，俱在脊中，属督脉。上发者，伤于肺，发于天柱骨下，为天柱发。中发者，伤于肝，为对心发。下发者，伤于肾，为对脐发。皆由积热怒气所致。初如粟米，或麻或痒，或拘急，或不痛，或大痛，初觉便宜隔蒜灸之，或汗、或下、或托，量其虚实施治。脑发背发在上者，不可用木通，恐导虚下元故也，老弱者尤宜戒。然三发背总要之地，与他处不同，尤所当谨。微有痛痒，宜速治之。活命饮加羌活、紫金丹、胜金丹、夺命丹选用。壮实者，一粒金丹、八阵散等下之。老弱者，黄芪木香散、十全大补汤托之。

　　或问：背上麻木不常，时肿时塌，忽软忽硬，乍寒乍热，何如？曰：此名阴阳疽，由七情内乖，阴阳不和也。此证必大渴。神清脉定者，可治，活命饮加羌活，或胜金丹、夺命丹选用。昏迷躁乱，饮食不进者，死。十日得黄白脓者，可治；数日无脓者，死。
　　　　　禽疽

　　或问：背忽麻木，拘急不痛，十数处肉紫，色如拳触状，何如？曰：此名禽疽，七日内寒热口噤者，死。急服活命饮加羌活、独活，胜金丹，夺命丹。得汗可治，无汗不治。神清脉和，可治。神昏脉躁，或微或代者，死。漫肿不溃，宜服台阁紫微丸。　　禽疽始发者，如疹，数十处如拳打状，发寒齿噤，如此者十四日死。十日可刺，导引脓出，即愈。

　　　　　老鼠攒

　　　　　竟体发

　　或问：背上生疽，肉色不变，麻木微痒，顽如牛领之皮二三尺许，何如？曰：此名竟体发，亦名椒眼发，由盛暑时空腹感触秽气，及愤怒积郁所致，宜活命饮加羌活，或黄连解毒汤、胜金丹、乌金散选用。壮实者，八阵散、一粒金丹下之。七日内未成脓，宜隔蒜灸。灸而起发，神清脉和者，可治；灸而不起，腹胀神昏，脉微或促或代者，死。服汗剂得汗者生，无汗者死。服补剂红润起发，知痛者，生；膨胀不食，干枯黑陷者，死。[60p]

Mouse Bumps (Laoshu Zuan)

Someone asked: Between the back and the armpits, what about three or two spots of sores? I replied: This is called "mouse bumps," also known as "wandering blood spleen sores," caused by accumulated anger and heat. It often occurs in the Gallbladder and Liver meridians of the feet. It is advisable to use remedies that regulate qi and clear heat, such as Huanglian Jiedu Decoction, Huoming Decoction plus Huanglian and Zhi Zi, and also take Zijing Dan. For strong individuals, a single pill of gold essence should be taken. For the elderly and weak, choose Huangqi Muxiang San or Neibu Shixuan San. If there is no pus after seven days, and if there are signs of black depression and agitation, death is imminent.

Body Sores (Jingtifa)

Someone asked: If a sore appears on the back, with unchanged flesh color, slight numbness and itching, firm like the skin of a cow’s neck, measuring two or three feet, what about it? I replied: This is called "body sores," also known as "pepper eye sores," caused by exposure to foul air while fasting under the intense heat of summer, and by suppressed anger. It is advisable to use Huoming Decoction plus Qianghuo, or Huanglian Jiedu Decoction, Shengjindan, or Wujin San. For strong individuals, take Bazhen San or a single gold essence pill. If it has not formed pus within seven days, it is advisable to apply garlic moxibustion. If moxibustion produces a sore and the spirit is clear with harmonious pulse, it can be treated; if there is no reaction, and if there is abdominal distention with confusion, a weak or intermittent pulse indicates death. Taking sweating agents to induce sweating indicates survival; without sweating indicates death. If tonic agents cause a rosy appearance and a sore develops, indicating pain, survival is possible; if it expands without food, and is dry and black, death is imminent.[60p]

　　　　　酒毒发疽

　　或问：背当心而痛，麻木不常，累累如弹如拳，坚硬如石，痛彻五内，遍身拘急，何如？曰：此名酒毒发疽，由饥饱劳伤，炙煿厚味所致，宜服黄连解毒汤加羌活、干葛，或神效消毒散、内疏黄连汤、紫金锭、胜金丹选用。神昏脉乱，大渴狂言，有妨饮食者，死。二便闭结者，死。有因寒变而内陷者，用托里温中汤。
　　　　　黄瓜痈

　　或问：背侧生疽，高二寸，长尺许，状如黄瓜，肉色不变，何如？曰：此名黄瓜痈，一名肉□，疼痛引心，四肢麻木是也。此证多不可治，急服紫金丹、胜金丹、活命饮加羌活、柴胡，及夺命丹，神仙追毒丸选用。脉微自汗谵语者，死。平塌黑色者，独姜散主之，服台阁紫微丸。[61p]

Alcohol Toxicity Abscess

If someone asks: "I feel pain on my back and heart area, numbness is not common, with lumps like bullets or fists, hard as stone, pain penetrating deep within, and my body feels constrained; what should I do?" The response is: This is called alcohol toxicity abscess, caused by hunger, excessive eating, physical labor, and the consumption of rich flavors. It is advisable to take Huang Lian Jie Du Decoction with added Qiang Huo and Gan Cao, or Shen Xiao Xiao Du San, internal dispersing Huang Lian Decoction, Zi Jin Ding, or select Sheng Jin Dan. If the spirit is confused and the pulse is chaotic, with great thirst and delirious speech affecting eating, it can be fatal. If there are difficulties with urination and bowel movements, it can also be fatal. If it is caused by cold leading to internal collapse, use Tuo Li Wen Zhong Decoction.

Cucumber Abscess

If someone asks: "There is an abscess on my back side, two inches high and about a foot long, shaped like a cucumber, with unchanged flesh color; what should I do?" The response is: This is known as cucumber abscess, also called meat abscess, causing pain that affects the heart, along with numbness in the limbs. This condition is often difficult to treat; quickly take Zi Jin Dan, Sheng Jin Dan, and Huo Ming Yin with Qiang Huo and Chai Hu, and select Duo Ming Dan or Shen Xian Chui Du Wan. If the pulse is weak with spontaneous sweating and delirium, it can be fatal. If it is flat and black in color, use Du Jiang San, and take Tai Ge Zi Wei Wan.[61p]

　　　　　龙疽

　　或问：第九椎两旁，忽肿痛而无头，寒热大作，何如？曰：此名龙疽，即中搭也，属太阳经，由愤怒积热所致。壮实者，急服一粒金丹，或八阵散下之。活命饮加柴胡、羌活、黄芩，水酒各半煎服。老弱者，黄芪木香散、内补十宣散、十全大补汤选用。色赤起发润泽者，可治。色黑低陷，恶心眩运，大便滑泄，小便如淋，谵语者，死。
　　　　　丹毒发疽

　　或问：背上细(疒畾)无数，浸淫一二尺，如汤火伤，烦躁多渴，何如？曰：此丹毒发疽也，因服丹石刚剂所致。红润者，生。紫黯者，死。恶证少者，宜服黄连消毒散、胜金丹、国老膏。恶证多神昏脉躁，膨胀呕哕者，死。[62p]

Dragon Sores

Someone asked: "On both sides of the ninth vertebra, there is sudden swelling and pain without a head, with intense cold and heat; what should be done?" The answer: "This is called 'Dragon Sores,' which is a condition of the middle jiao, belonging to the Taiyang channel, caused by accumulated heat from anger. For robust individuals, urgently take a grain of gold elixir, or administer 'Eight Array Powder.' For life-saving, mix Chaihu, Qianghuo, and Huangqin in equal parts with water and wine and decoct. For the elderly or weak, use Huangqi and Muxiang powder, Neibu Shixuan powder, or choose from Shiquan Dabu Decoction. If the sores are red, raised, and moist, they can be treated. If they are black, sunken, cause nausea, dizziness, with slippery stools and painful urination, accompanied by delirium, this may lead to death.

Dandruff Sores

Someone asked: "There are countless small spots on the back, soaking two feet in size, like burns from hot water, with agitation and thirst; what should be done?" The answer: "This is dandruff sores, caused by taking strong dan stone medications. If red and moist, the prognosis is good. If dark purple, the prognosis is poor. For those with mild symptoms, take Huanglian Xiaodu powder, Shengjindan, or Guolao ointment. For those with severe symptoms such as unconsciousness, rapid pulse, and swelling with nausea, the prognosis is very poor and may lead to death."[62p]

　　　　　蜂窝发

　　或问：背患疽，状如蜂房，十日而平塌，寒热痛楚殊甚，饮食少进，膨胀淋沥，何如？曰：此蜂窠发也，其脉微而迟，四肢厥冷，为不足，乃过服耗气之剂，又暴怒而然。用活命饮加参、芪、归、朮，兼以乌药、青皮、木香，间与紫金丹服之。起发脓溃，服十全大补汤。
　　　　外科正宗 【明□陈实功】

　　　　　发背阳证歌

　　痈疽不论上中下，惟在阴阳二证推。发背虽有正与偏，要取高低两样看。纯阳初起必臖肿，更兼身热有微寒。顶如尖字高突起，肿似弯弓根有盘。七日之间多臖痛，二七之期脓渐漫。动息自宁食知味，二便调匀无泻干。肿消脓溃精神爽，脱腐生新气血完。五善自然臻并至，七恶全无半点干。痛便随脓减，肿退自肌宽。新肉已生红艳艳，腐皮自敛白漫漫。一身多爽快，五脏尽和欢。此属纯阳俱易活，百人百可保平安。[63p]

Beehive Carbuncle

Someone asked: If one has a carbuncle on the back, resembling a beehive, flattening after ten days, with severe chills, fever, and pain, and little appetite, leading to swelling and dripping, what should be done? The answer: This is a beehive carbuncle. Its pulse is weak and slow, with cold limbs, indicating deficiency. This has resulted from excessive consumption of qi-depleting agents and sudden anger. Use the Life-Saving Decoction with ginseng, astragalus, angelica, and atractylodes, along with old and young areca nut, green tangerine peel, and cardamom, alternating with the Purple Gold Pill. When pus forms and discharges, take the Complete Nourishing Decoction.

Orthodox External Medicine 【Ming Dynasty, Chen Shigong】

Song of the Yang Manifestation on the Back

For abscesses and carbuncles, regardless of being upper, middle, or lower categorized, one must depend solely on the yin and yang to differentiate. Although there are correct and deviant manifestations in beehive carbuncles, one must observe both elevation and depression. When pure yang first arises, it must swell and be tender, accompanied by a slight fever and chills. The top protrudes sharply, resembling the point of a spear, with swelling akin to the root of a bent bow. Within seven days, there is much discomfort, and after fourteen days, pus gradually spreads. Motion and stillness become known, and food is delicious; bowel movements are regular, without diarrhea. As the swelling subsides, pus discharges, and one feels refreshed; rotten flesh gives way, replaced by new vigor and complete blood circulation. Naturally, five good conditions arrive, and seven evils are completely absent. Pain diminishes as pus decreases, swelling recedes and the flesh expands. New flesh begins to bloom, vivid red, while rotten skin retracts and turns pale. The whole body feels light and joyful, and the five organs are in harmony. This belongs to pure yang, easily revivable; a hundred out of a hundred can be ensured peace and safety.[63p]

　　　　　阴证歌

　　纯阴初起不知疮，粟米之形疙瘩僵。不红不肿不知痛，少热少臖少堤防。七朝之后身体倦，疮根平大喜浇汤。顶不高兮根不活，色不光兮腐不穰。软陷无脓空结聚，脉浮散大细飞扬。饮食不餐身战战，尝汤止许意忙忙。疮上生衣如脱甲，孔中结子似含芳。脓多臭秽身难便，举动仓皇韵不长。疮形成紫黑，面色变青黄。精神昏愦多鼾睡，言语无人自发扬。口干多舌强，痰喘定身亡。此属纯阴俱不治，百人百可到泉乡。
　　　　　半阴半阳证歌

　　阴阳之证两相交，生死同兼事可招。微热微寒微赤肿，半昏半爽半平高。脉来虽数多无力，饮食虽餐不易消。肿而不溃因脾弱，溃而不敛为脓饶。大便多溏小便数，上身有汗下身焦。五善虽兼有，七恶未全逃。口渴喜汤肠腹痛，面浮餍饮足心高。心烦不稳睡，神乱怕音焦。投方应病方为妙，阴转为阳渐可调。心真造化，命尔坚牢。逢之任是神仙手，半死余生定莫逃。[64p]

Song of Yin Syndromes

Pure Yin initially arises with no sores, resembling a grain structure with hard lumps. Not red, not swollen, unaware of pain, subtly warm, slightly rough, with minimal precautions. After seven mornings, the body feels weary, sore roots are even and rejoice in hot broth. The top is not high, the root not alive, the color lacks brightness and decays without grain. Soft, sunken, without pus, empty aggregation, the pulse floats, disperses, large and small, rising and falling. Meals are unconsumed, the body trembles, tasting broth just for the sake of it. On the sores, a covering appears like shedding armor, and the knots in the holes seem to harbor fragrance. Excess pus, foul odors, difficult bodily functions, movements frantic, rhythms don't last. Sores form purple-black, facial complexion shifts to green-yellow. Spirit foggy and dazed, much snoring during sleep, speech without anyone to express it. Mouth is dry, tongue thick, phlegm and wheezing lead to death. This belongs to pure Yin, which cannot be treated; each hundred can reach the spring town.

Song of Half Yin Half Yang Syndromes

The signs of Yin and Yang interweave, life and death coexist, inviting matters. Mild heat, mild cold, slight redness and swelling, half dazed, half refreshed, half elevated. Though the pulse comes fast, it lacks strength; even with meals, digestion is not easy. Swollen but not ruptured due to weak spleen; ruptured but not confined due to excessive pus. Frequent loose stools, numerous urination, sweating above, dryness below. Although five virtues coexist, seven evils are not fully escaped. Mouth thirsts for broth, abdominal pain; face swells from drink, heart elevated. Heart troubled, unstable sleep, spirit confused, feared sounds disturb. Prescribing according to the condition is wonderful; as Yin turns to Yang, gradual adjustments are possible. True heart creates transformation, your fate is solid and strong. Encountering this is divine intervention; half-dead, the remaining life should not flee.[64p]

　　　　　绷缚背疮法

　　发背已溃，流脓时，冬夏宜绢帛四五层，放贴膏药，外再用棉布八寸，四角用蛇皮细带贮之，安盖绢上，以带扎在前胸，绷实疮上，庶使疮中暖气不泄，易于腐溃。洗疮时，预备二绷更换，务要患内暖气烘烘。
　　　　医门法律 【清□喻昌】

　　　　　恶寒

　　少阴病得之一二日，口中和，其背恶寒者，用灸及附子汤外内协攻之法。夫口中和而不燥不渴，其无里证可知。况背为督脉，总督诸阳上行之地，他处不寒，独觉背间寒，其为阳虚阴邪上凑可知。故外灸内温，两法并施，必求阴消阳复而后已。不知者，谓伤寒才一二日，外证且轻，何反张皇若此？讵识仲景正以一二日即显阳虚阴盛之证，早从暴病施治，此见微知着也。若待至三四日，势必极盛难返，不可救药矣。
　　　　　作痛[65p]

Bandaging Method for Back Sores

When the back sore has burst and is purulent, regardless of winter or summer, it is advisable to use four or five layers of silk cloth, applying a medicinal plaster externally. Additionally, use an eight-inch piece of cotton cloth, securing it with thin snake skin strips at the corners, and place it over the silk to anchor tightly on the sore. This method helps retain warmth within the sore, facilitating the process of decay. When cleaning the sore, prepare two bands for replacement, ensuring that the internal warmth is maintained.

Chills

In a case of Shaoyin disease lasting one or two days, if the mouth feels comfortable but there is a sensation of chills in the back, one should use moxibustion and Fuzi soup to treat both internally and externally. If the mouth feels comfortable and neither dry nor thirsty, it indicates no internal pathological evidence. The back is governed by the Governor Vessel, which oversees the rising yang energies; if there is no chill elsewhere but solely in the back, it is evident that there is an abnormality of yang deficiency and the intrusion of yin pathogens. Therefore, both external moxibustion and internal warming should be combined, with the goal of eliminating yin and restoring yang. Those who lack understanding may believe that if the illness has only lasted one or two days and the external symptoms are mild, there is no need for such urgency. However, Zhang Zhongjing highlighted that in just one or two days, signs of yang deficiency and excess yin might already manifest, necessitating early treatment of acute illnesses. Waiting until the third or fourth day will result in a condition that becomes extremely severe and difficult to reverse, rendering it untreatable.[65p]

　　心痛彻背，背痛彻心，乃阴寒之气，厥逆而上干者，横格于胸背经脉之间，牵连痛楚，乱其气血，紊其疆界，此而用气分诸药，则转益其痛，势必危殆。仲景用乌头赤石脂丸，以蜀椒、乌头一派辛辣，以温散其阴邪，然恐胸背既乱之气难安，而即于温药队中，即用干姜之泥，赤石脂之濇，以填塞厥气所横冲之新隧，俾胸之气自行于胸，背之气自行于背，各不相犯，其患乃除，此炼石补天之精义也。今人知有温气、补气、行气、散气诸法矣，亦知有堵塞邪气攻冲之窦，令胸背阴阳二气并行不悖者哉！
　　　　石室秘箓 【清□陈士铎】

　　　　　疼痛

　　背脊骨痛者，乃肾水衰耗，不能上润于脑，则河车之路，干濇而难行，故尔作痛。此等证非一二剂可以见功，非久服补气之药以生阴，非大服补阴之药以生水，未易奏功也。方用黄芪、熟地各一两，山茱萸、麦门冬各四钱，北五味一钱，白朮五钱，防风五分，茯苓三钱，附子一分，水煎服。[66p]

The heart pains through the back, and the back pains through the heart; this is the chilling energy that reverses upward and obstructs, accumulating between the chest and back meridians, leading to interlinked pain, disrupting the flow of qi and blood, and disturbing its boundaries. If one uses herbs to disperse the qi, it will only intensify the pain and may become perilous. Zhang Zhongjing used the Wutou and Chishizhi pills, incorporating Sichuan pepper and Wutou for their spiciness to disperse the yin evil. Yet, fearing that the chaotic energy in the chest and back would be hard to settle, he included dried ginger and Chishizhi in the warm medicines to fill the obstructed qi paths, allowing the qi in the chest and back to flow freely, preventing mutual interference, thus resolving the ailment. This embodies the essence of transforming stone to mend the heavens. Today, people recognize the methods of warming qi, tonifying qi, moving qi, and dispersing qi, as well as knowing how to clear obstructed paths of evil qi to enable the yin and yang energies of the chest and back to work harmoniously.

As for the pain in the spine, it arises from the depletion of kidney water, which fails to nourish the brain; thus, the pathway of the river cart becomes dry and hard to traverse, leading to pain. Such symptoms cannot be resolved with just one or two doses; it requires prolonged use of tonifying herbs to nourish yin and significantly taking tonics to replenish water for noticeable effect. The formula includes Huangqi and Shudi each one tael, Shanzhuyu and Mai MenDong each four qian, Beiwuweizi one qian, Baizhu five qian, Fangfeng five fen, and Fuling three qian, with Fuzhu one fen, boiled in water for oral administration.[66p]

此方，补气则有黄芪、白朮，补水则有熟地、山萸，去湿则有茯苓，去风则有防风，引经则有附子，而又有麦冬以生肾水之母，自然金旺生水，水足则河车之路不干，不干则润金滋骨可知，又何痛之作楚？既不痛矣，又何背之不直哉？然此方不能奏功于旦夕，必须多服久服乃效。　　如人患背疼者，人以为心病而非心也，乃膀胱之气化不行，故上阻滞而作痛，法当清其膀胱之火，背痛自止。盖膀胱乃肾之腑，肾虚膀胱亦虚，夹脊乃河车之路，膀胱借肾道而行，所以背脊作楚耳。方用熟地一两，肉桂三分，车前子、泽泻各三钱，薏仁、茯苓、芡实各五钱，水煎服二剂，膀胱之水道大通，而背脊之疼亦愈矣。盖熟地乃补肾之圣剂，肾足而膀胱之气亦足，况又有茯苓、车前、薏仁类以泻其水，肉桂又引入诸药，直达膀胱以通其气，自然化行而水泄，水泄而火散，上行之郁结，有何不除？此病之所以立效也。[67p]

In this prescription, to tonify Qi, there are Astragalus and Atractylodes; to nourish the essence, there are prepared Rehmannia and Chinese Wolfberry; to dispel dampness, there is Poria; to expel wind, there is Siler; to guide the efficacy, there is Aconite; and there is also Ophiopogon to nourish the source of kidney water. Naturally, when Metal is strong, it produces Water; when Water is sufficient, the path of the river cart will not be dry. If it is not dry, then Metal will be moistened and bones nourished, so why suffer from pain? If there is no pain, then why is the back not straight? Yet, this prescription will not show results overnight; it requires prolonged use to be effective.

For someone suffering from back pain, people might think it is a heart issue, but in reality, it is due to the disruption of the bladder's Qi. Consequently, the upper body is obstructed, resulting in pain. The method here should clear the fire of the bladder to alleviate the pain in the back. The bladder is the organ associated with the kidneys; when the kidneys are deficient, the bladder is also weak. The spine acts as the pathway of the river cart, with the bladder operating through the kidney's channel, hence the discomfort in the back.

The prescription includes one tael of prepared Rehmannia, three fen of cinnamon, three qian each of Plantago seed and Alisma, and five qian each of Job's tears, Poria, and Euryale seed, decocted in water to take as two doses. This allows for the large passage of the bladder's water route, and the back pain will also subside. Prepared Rehmannia is the supreme agent for tonifying the kidneys, and with sufficient kidneys, the bladder's Qi will also be strong. Moreover, with Poria, Plantago, and Job's tears to help drain the water, and cinnamon to guide the various herbs to the bladder to unblock its Qi, naturally the fluids will flow and the fire will disperse, resolving any stagnation. What issue would remain? This is why the treatment is effective.[67p]

　　　　　开裂出蛇虱

　　如人有背上忽然疼痛，裂开一缝，撺出蛇一条，长二尺者，颇善跳跃。予亲手治之而验其证，必先背脊痛甚而又无肿块，久则肿矣，长有一尺许一条，直似立在脊上，予乃用刀轻轻破其皮，其蛇忽跳出，其人惊绝。予乃用人参一两，半夏、南星各三钱，附子一钱治之，忽苏。生肌散敷其患处而愈。　　人有背脊裂开一缝，出虱千余，此乃肾中有风，得阳气吹之，不觉破裂而虱现。方用熟地、山茱萸各三两，杜仲一两，白朮五钱，防己一钱，豨莶草三钱，二剂裂缝，生虱尽死。　　又有一方，用蓖麻三粒，研成如膏，用红枣三枚，捣成为丸，如弹子大，火烧之，熏衣上，则虱死而缝合。亦绝奇方也，真不可思议矣。蓖麻子能杀虱，虱去风出，则缝自合矣。[68p]

Crack Revealing Snake Lice

If a person suddenly experiences pain in their back, a crack opens, and a snake about two feet long jumps out, it is very good at leaping. I have personally treated this and confirmed the symptoms: there must first be severe pain in the spine without swelling; if it lasts long, swelling will occur, and a snake approximately one foot long will grow, seemingly standing upright on the spine. I then lightly cut the skin with a knife, and the snake jumps out, startling the person immensely. I treated this with one tael of ginseng, three qian each of pinellia and rhizoma arisaema, and one qian of aconite; it suddenly revived. A flesh-repairing powder was applied to the affected area, and it healed.

If a person has a crack in the spine from which over a thousand lice emerge, this is due to wind in the kidneys being blown by yang energy, leading to the unnoticed rupture and appearance of lice. The prescription uses three taels each of cooked rehmannia and cornus fruit, one tael of eucommia, five qian of white atractylodes, one qian of twining vine, and three qian of equal-leaved sweet herb; two doses for the crack will completely kill the lice.

There is also another recipe using three seeds of castor bean, ground into a paste, and three red dates, pounded into balls the size of a marble, burned and then smoked on clothes; this will kill the lice and heal the crack. This is indeed an extraordinary recipe, truly inconceivable. Castor seeds can kill lice; once the lice are gone and the wind exits, the crack will naturally close.[68p]

　　(艹舌)蒌薤白白酒汤 【 《金匮要略》，下同】 　治胷背痛。　　(艹舌)蒌实一枚，捣　薤白半斤　白酒七升　　右三味同煮，取二升，分温再服。

　　乌头赤石脂丸　治心痛彻背，背痛彻心者。　　蜀椒　赤石脂各一两，一法各二分　乌头一分，炮　附子半两，炮；一法一分　干姜一两，一法一分　　右五味，末之，蜜丸如梧子大，先食服一丸，日三服。不知，稍加服。[69p]

Fang

Luo Qi Bai Bai Jiu Tang: For treating pain in the chest and back. Ingredients: One piece of Luo Shi, half a pound of Qi Bai, seven sheng of white wine. Cook these three ingredients together to produce two sheng; take one dose warm, twice.

Luo Qi Bai Ban Xia Tang: For treating chest obstruction that prevents lying down and for heart pain that radiates to the back. Ingredients: One piece of Luo Shi, three taels of Qi Bai, half a sheng of Ban Xia (washed), ten sheng of white wine. Cook these four ingredients together to yield four sheng; take one sheng warm, three times daily.

Wu Tou Chi Shi Zhi Wan: For treating heart pain radiating to the back and back pain radiating to the heart. Ingredients: One tael each of Shu Jiao and Chi Shi Zhi, two fen of each, one fen of Wu Tou (processed), half a tael of processed Fu Zi, one fen of each, one tael of dry ginger, one fen of each. Grind these five ingredients into a powder, mix with honey into pills the size of a walnut. Take one pill before meals, three times daily. For those uncertain, gradually increase dosage.[69p]

　　通气散　治风热肩背痛。

　　丁香五套丸 【 《和剂局方》】 　治肩背痛。　　南星每个切作十数块，同半夏先用水浸三日，每日易水，次用白矾二两研碎，调入水内，再浸三日，洗净焙干　半夏切，各二两　干姜炮　白朮良姜　白茯苓各一两　木香　丁香俱不见火　青皮　陈皮去白，各半两。　　右为末，用神曲一两，大麦蘖二两，同研取末，打糊丸如梧桐子大，每服五十丸，加至七十丸，不拘时，热水送下。[70p]

Tongqi San: Treats wind-heat shoulder and back pain.
With 8 parts each of Fengfeng (Siler), Gaoben (Japanese Angelica), and Qianghuo (Notopterygium); 1 qian each of Huangqin (Scutellaria), stir-fried in wine, and Huanglian (Coptis), stir-fried in ginger juice. Prepare as needed, decocting in water for consumption. Add Ren Shen (Ginseng) if deficiency is present.

Tongqi Fang (from Dongyuan's Ten Books): Treats shoulder and back pain.
1 qian each of Chaihu (Bupleurum), Chuan Shengma (Rhizoma Cimicifuga), and Huangqi (Astragalus); 5 fen each of Fengfeng, Qianghuo, Chenpi (dried tangerine peel), Ren Shen, and Gancao (licorice); 2 fen of Baidoukou (Cardamom); 1 fen of Huangbo (phellodendron); 3 fen each of Gaoben and Qingpi (green peel). Decoct in water and take warm after meals. Those with excess qi should take; those with pale complexion and shortness of breath should not.

Dingxiang Wutao Wan (from Heji Ju Fang): Treats shoulder and back pain.
Each Nanxing (Jack-in-the-pulpit) cut into about 10 pieces, soak with Banxia (Pinellia) in water for three days, changing the water daily. Then use 2 liang of powdered Alumen to mix with water and soak for another three days, wash clean and dry. Cut Banxia, 2 liang; add 1 liang each of dry ginger, Baizhu (Atractylodes), Liangjiang (Galangal), Baifuling (Poria), Mu Xiang (Saussurea), and Dingxiang (Clove) without fire. Half liang each of Qingpi and Chenpi, removing the white part.
Grind into a powder, mix with 1 liang of Shenchu (fermented grains) and 2 liang of barley sprouts, and grind into a fine powder. Form into pills the size of Chinese parasol seeds, taking 50 to 70 pills at a time, no specific timing, with hot water.[70p]

Xia Qi Tang
For treating fullness and heaviness in the chest, abdomen, and back, along with shortness of breath.
Ingredients:

  • Xing Ren: 47 pieces
  • Da Fu: 27 pieces
  • Bing Lang: 27 pieces [71p]

　　右三味，(口父)咀，以童子小便三升，煎取一升半，分再服。曾患气发，辄合服之，便瘥。
　　槟榔汤　主破胸背恶气，音声塞闭。　　极大槟榔四枚　极小槟榔八枚
　　右一味二品，(口父)咀，以小儿尿二升半，煮减一升，去滓。分三服，频与五剂，永定。　　又方　治膀胱实热背强痛。
　　栀子仁一作瓜子仁　茯苓　知母各三两　淡竹叶　生地黄切，各一升　蜜五合　石膏八两　　右七味，(口父)咀，以水七升，煮取二升，去滓，下蜜，煮二沸，分三服。须利，加芒硝三两。
　　御寒膏 【 《古今医鉴》，下同】 　治体虚人背上恶寒，或夏月怕脱衣；及妇人产后被风冷，手足冷痛至骨。又治腰痛。　　生姜半斤，取自然汁　明胶三两　乳香　没药各一钱半，共入姜汁内　　右于铜杓内煎化，移在滚汤内顿，以柳条搅至成膏；又入川椒末少许，再搅匀，用皮纸摊贴患处，以鞋底烘热熨之，候五七日脱下。或起小疮，不妨。[72p]

The recipe for the three ingredients: chew them, using three sheng of a child's urine, boil down to one and a half sheng, and divide for two doses. When experiencing gas disturbances, taking it together will lead to recovery.

Betel nut decoction: Treats bad energy in the chest and back, and blockages in voice and breathing. Use four large betel nuts and eight small ones, chew and combine, using two and a half sheng of a child's urine, boil down to one sheng, and remove residue. Divide into three doses and frequently administer five doses for lasting results.

Another prescription: For treating bladder heat and severe back pain, using three liang of gardenia seeds (or cucumber seeds), poria, and anemarrhena, each three liang; one sheng each of fresh bamboo leaves and raw rehmannia, five he of honey, and eight liang of gypsum. Chew the seven ingredients, using seven sheng of water, boil down to two sheng, remove residue, add honey, boil twice, and divide into three doses. For issues with hard stool, increase with three liang of natron.

Cold-resisting ointment: Treats individuals with physical weakness feeling cold in the back, or those who fear exposing themselves in summer; also for women postpartum suffering from wind chills, cold hands and feet, and severe pain. For this, use half a jin of fresh ginger to extract juice, three liang of gelatin, and one and a half qian each of frankincense and myrrh, combine into the ginger juice. Boil the mixture in a copper ladle, then transfer into boiling soup and stir until it turns into a paste. Add a little ground Sichuan pepper, mix thoroughly, and apply the paste onto the affected area with skin paper. Heat with the bottom of a shoe for warming, and after five to seven days, remove. Small sores may appear, but they are not a problem.[72p]

　　三合汤　治背心一点痛。

　　苍朮复煎汤 【 《丹溪心法》】 　治寒湿相合，脑痛脊骨胛眼痛，膝膑痛。　　苍朮四两　羌活　升麻　泽泻　柴胡　槁本　白朮各五分　黄蘗三分　红花少许　　右銼，先以苍朮，用水二碗，煎至一碗，去滓；入群药于苍朮汤内，再煎至半，去滓服。
　　白散子　治发背，候取下毒无，次用清凉膏贴之。　　白附子　大香附子各半两　半夏一分，姜制　黑牵牛二两，半生半炒令熟　大甘遂一分，以大麦炒候黄，若赤色不用，须极慢火炒之　　右为末，量患人虚实加减，每服二钱，以蜜酒调下，续饮温酒一两盏，候所苦处刺痛为度，微利三五行，泻出恶物，即瘥。次用膏药贴之。气盛者，一服二钱，余更裁度。[73p]

Sanhe Decoction treats a sharp pain in the center of the back.

Wuyao Shunqi San combined with Erchen Decoction, Xiangsu San with added Qianghuo and Cangzhu. Boil with water and take orally.

Cangzhu Pre-cooked Decoction (from "Danxi Heart Method") treats the combination of cold and dampness, headaches, pain in the spine, shoulder, and eye pain, as well as knee pain. Use four taels of Cangzhu, five fen each of Qianghuo, Shengma, Zexie, Chaihu, and Gaoben, three fen of Huangbo, a little bit of Honghua. First, take Cangzhu, using two bowls of water, boil down to one bowl, strain; then add the other herbs to the Cangzhu decoction, boil down to half, strain, and take.

Baifanzi treats hair loss on the back; wait to see whether the poison is expelled before applying a cooling plaster. Use half a tael each of Bai Fuzhu and Da Xiang Fuzhu, one fen of Bansha (prepared with ginger), two taels of Heiqian Niu (half raw and half cooked), one fen of Da Gansui (carefully pan-fried until yellow, avoid red color, fry slowly), then grind into a powder. Adjust dosage according to the patient's condition, take two qian each time, mixed with honey wine, and continue drinking warm wine until the painful area feels a slight sting, leading to the expulsion of toxins. Apply a plaster afterward. For those with excess energy, take two qian and adjust as necessary.[73p]

　　清凉膏　治发背等，先用白散子取之，次用此药贴之。　　当归二两　香白芷　木鳖子肉　白芨　芍药　黄蘗　白蔹各一两　乳香别研　白胶香别研　腻粉各少许　黄丹五两　　右用清麻油十两煎前六味，候紫色去之；入槐柳枝各七寸，再煎，少顷又去之；入黄丹五两，熬成，入乳香等，重绵滤入罐子内贮之，用如常贴使。
　　猪蹄汤　一切发背等证，用此洗之，能消毒气，去恶肉，凡疮有口急用之。　　香白芷　黄芩　赤芍药　露蜂房小孔多为佳　当归　羌活　生草　地骨皮　先将雄猪前蹄一只，以水四碗，煮熟去蹄，取汁，澄去面上油腻，取清汁加前药，煎三四滚，取汁，将败笔或软绢蘸药汤徐徐洗之。须要避风，并人口中气。
　　透脓散　痈疽发背，不用开刀，服之，一日夜，自透出一头。　　蛾口茧出了蛾者[74p]

Cooling Ointment: For treating back hair and similar conditions, first use white powder to take it out, then apply this medicine as a patch. The ingredients are: two taels of Angelica, one tael each of fragrant white atractylodes, the flesh of the wood peach seed, white ginger, peony, yellow barberry, and white lily; also a small amount of myrrh and white benzoin, and a little bit of fat powder; five taels of yellow lead.

Prepare ten taels of clear sesame oil to simmer the first six ingredients until they turn purple; then add branches of locust and willow each seven inches long and simmer again, removing the residue; add five taels of yellow lead, boil down, then add myrrh and others, filter through thick cotton and store in a jar. Use as a patch as usual.

Pig's Hoof Soup: Use this to wash conditions like back hair; it can disinfect and remove unwanted flesh. For sores that are open and urgent, use this. Ingredients: fragrant white atractylodes, yellow gentian, red peony, bee nest with many small pores is preferable, Angelica, tachyon, fresh herbs, and ground earth skin. First, take one front hoof from a male pig, boil it in four bowls of water until cooked, remove the hoof, and take the broth, skimming off the oily surface to get the clear broth. Add the earlier herbs, boil for three or four rounds, then take the broth and slowly wash the affected area with soft cloth or silk dipped in the medicinal broth. Avoid wind, and also check the breath of the patient.

Suppurating Powder: For carbuncles and similar conditions, without needing surgery, take this and it will drain out in a day or night. Ingredients include moth cocoon and the moth that has emerged.[74p]

　　右将一枚烧作灰，用酒调服。切不可用两枚、三枚。若服一枚只一头，多服多头。　　又方　治发背痈疽恶疮。

Take one piece and burn it to ash, then mix it with wine for consumption. Do not use two or three pieces. If you take one piece, it only targets one area; taking more can affect multiple areas.

Another formula for treating carbuncles and ulcerative sores:
Ginseng, astragalus, angelica, and white atractylodes, each five qian; tangerine peel, one and a half qian. Crush and decoct in water, then mix with bamboo juice and ginger juice to take. If you want to prepare it as a paste, add four liang each of ginseng and astragalus. For swellings, add angelica, forsythia, and qianghuo. For ulcers, add peony, chuanxiong, licorice, and white atractylodes. For alcohol toxicity, add wine-fried coptis. For qi issues, add fried cyperus. For phlegm, add trichosanthes seeds. For fever, add wine-fried scutellaria. For thirst, add mugi and tianhuafen. For nausea, add pinellia, ginger, and patchouli. For detoxification, add honeysuckle and licorice stems. For diarrhea, add fragrant atractylodes and white atractylodes, both stir-fried. For issues in the sun channel, add qianghuo; in the lesser yang channel, add bupleurum; in the yangming channel, add mouse glue, white atractylodes, and bulbil.

Shengong Huomingtang is used to treat carbuncles and sores on the back:

Huanglian Jiedu Decoction: Treats spine-related heart issues.

Miaotie Powder: Treats flowing heat affecting the back.

Twenty-Four Flavors Flowing Qi Drink: Treats similar symptoms.

Sour Decoction of Ten Extractions for the same symptoms mentioned above.
Ingredients:

旋加桑柳槐枝各二斤，凤仙梗、豨莶草、益母草、芊芊活、见肿消等草各少许新鲜者，有水气，缓缓下之。若骤下则油泛上发浮，慎之慎之！待药焦黑，滤净滓，入油磁瓶中。此药必用丝绵衬麻布滤，方精制。再入锅内，慢火煎，油滴水不散为度。春夏明净松香一斤，下油二两，柳枝搅匀，候药温，旋下乳香、血竭、没药各一两，麝香一钱。春初天气尚寒，每斤再加油半两，秋初亦如之。冬月严寒，松香一斤，下油四两，细药同前搅至不粘手为度，倾入水中，多令人蘸水，炼如黄金色，再入水中浸三日，出火毒，任用。每药油一斤，加天鹅油一两，能使诸药透入骨髓。　　附：炼松香法[83p]

Add two pounds each of mulberry, willow, and locust branches, along with a small amount of fresh materials: balsam pear stalks, pigweed, motherwort, fresh herbs, and other anti-inflammatory herbs, ensuring they have moisture. Gradually add them; if added suddenly, the oil will float and be foamy—be cautious! Once the medicine turns black, filter out the residue and place it in an oil container. This medicine must be filtered using silk cotton and linen cloth for precise refinement.

Next, put it in a pot and slowly simmer until the oil achieves a state where water droplets do not disperse. In spring and summer, add one pound of clear pine resin, two ounces of oil, and stir in the willow branches. When warm, quickly add one ounce each of frankincense, dragon's blood, and myrrh, along with ten grams of musk. In early spring when it is still cold, add half an ounce of oil per pound; do the same in early autumn.

In cold winter months, use one pound of pine resin and four ounces of oil, mixing the fine herbs until they no longer stick to your hands. Pour into water; it will allow for a golden color. Soak for three days in water to remove toxic heat, and it's ready for use. For every pound of herbal oil, add one ounce of swan oil to help the ingredients penetrate the marrow.

Attachment: Method for refining pine resin.[83p]

　　松香不拘多少，入净锅中煎熬，柳棍搅之，俟其烊化，将稻柴滤净滓，俟冷结成块，取出任用。其砂石木屑，俱在柴中矣。
　　黄芪竹叶汤　治痈疽发背。
　　黄芪　甘草　黄芩　芍药　麦门冬各三两　当归　人参　石膏　芎藭　半夏制各二两　生地黄八两　大枣三十枚，擘淡竹叶一握　生姜五两　　右十四味，口□父咀，以水一斗二升，先煮竹叶，取一斗去滓，内药煮取三升，分四服，相去如人行二十里久，日三，夜一。
　　八味黄芪散 【 《千金方》，下同】 　治证同上。　　黄芪　芎藭　大黄　黄连　白芍药　莽草　黄芩　栀子仁各等分　　右八味，治下筛，鸡子白和如泥，涂故帛上，随肿大小傅之，干则易。若已开口，封疮上，须开头，令泄气。[84p]

Pine resin is not restricted in quantity; melt it in a clean pot, stirring with a willow stick until it liquefies. Filter out the rice straw and impurities, wait for it to cool and solidify into blocks, then remove for use. Any sand, stones, or wood shavings will remain in the straw.

Huangqi Bamboo Leaf Decoction: Treats carbuncles and boils on the back.
Ingredients: Huangqi, Licorice, Huangqin, Shaoyao, Maidong (each three taels), Danggui, Renshen, Shigao, Xiongshen, Banxia (processed) (each two taels), Shengdi (eight taels), thirty jujubes, a handful of split bamboo leaves, five taels of fresh ginger.
Combine the fourteen ingredients, grind finely, and use one dou and two sheng of water. First, boil the bamboo leaves, remove to obtain one dou of liquid. Boil the remaining medicines to produce three sheng, and divide into four doses, take them spaced out as if traveling twenty li, three times during the day and once at night.

Eight Flavor Huangqi Powder: Treats the same symptoms as above.
Ingredients: Huangqi, Xiongshen, Dahuang, Huanglian, Baishao, Mangcao, Huangqin, Zhiziren (each in equal parts).
Prepare the eight ingredients, sift them to a fine powder, mix with egg white to form a paste. Apply to a cloth as needed for the size of the swelling; it will dry and harden. If already opened, seal the wound, allowing it to release gas.[84p]

　　内补散　一名木占斯散，治痈疽发背，未溃者令消，不消者令速溃疾愈。　　木占斯　人参　干姜一作干地黄　桂心　细辛　厚朴　败酱　防风　花粉　桔梗　炙甘草各一两　　右十一味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，药下咽，觉流入疮中。若痈疽灸之不能发，已坏者，可服之。未坏者，去败酱；已发脓者内败酱。服药日七八服，夜二三服，以多为善。若病在下，当脓血出，此为肠痈也。诸病在里，惟服此药，即觉其力，痛者即不痛。常服去败酱。治诸疮疽痔疮，妇人乳痈已溃便早愈。医人不知用此药，发背无有治者。若始觉背上有不好处而渴者，即勤服之。若药力行，觉渴止，便消散。若经已坏，但日夜服之勿住药，肿自消散。一方无桂心。[85p]

Neibu San, also known as Muzhansi San, treats carbuncles and sores. For those that have not yet ulcerated, it promotes resolution; for those that do not resolve, it hastens ulceration and leads to recovery.

The ingredients are: Muzhansi, ginseng, dried ginger (also called dried rehmannia), cinnamon heart, Asarum, magnolia bark, bitter herb, Siler (or Fangfeng), pollen, Platycodon, and honey-fried licorice, each weighing one tael.

These eleven ingredients serve to treat internal blockages. Take with rice wine using a spoon, allowing the medicine to flow into the sore. If the carbuncles cannot break after moxibustion, or if they are already rotten, you may take this medicine. For those not rotten, omit the bitter herb; for those that have begun to suppurate, include the bitter herb. Take the medicine seven to eight times a day and two to three times at night; more is better.

If the condition is in the lower body, the pus and blood will emerge, indicating intestinal carbuncles. For various internal diseases, simply taking this medicine allows one to feel its effectiveness; pain will cease. Regular use means omitting the bitter herb. It treats all kinds of sores, carbuncles, hemorrhoids; for women, it helps with milk fever that has already ulcerated for quicker recovery.

If physicians do not recognize this medicine, they have no treatment for carbuncles. If you first notice an unfavorable area on your back and feel thirsty, take it diligently. Once the medicine takes effect and thirst is quenched, it will resolve. If it is already rotten, take it day and night without stopping; the swelling will dissipate on its own.

One version excludes the cinnamon heart.[85p]

　　生肉膏　治痈疽发背，坏后生肉。
　　薤白五两　生地黄一斤　辛夷二两　独活　当归　大黄　黄芪　芎藭　白芷　白芍药　黄芩　续断各一两　　右十二味，(口父)咀，以腊月猪脂四升，煎取白芷黄下之，去滓敷之，立瘥。　　又方　治证同上。
　　甘草　当归　白芷　肉苁蓉洗去鳞甲　蜀椒　细辛各二两　乌喙生用，六分　薤白二十茎　干地黄三两　蛇衔一两　　右十味，(口父)咀，以酢半斤渍一宿，次内猪膏三斤，煎令沸，三上三下，膏成，涂之立瘥。[86p]

Fresh Meat Paste: Treats carbuncles and boils, promotes the regeneration of flesh after necrosis.

Ingredients:

  • 250 grams of Chinese scallion
  • 500 grams of raw Rehmannia
  • 100 grams of magnolia flower
  • 50 grams each of common angelica, rhubarb, astragalus, and chuanxiong
  • 50 grams each of white atractylodes, white peony, and yellow complex
  • 50 grams of healing herb

Preparation: Take the twelve ingredients, crush them, and mix with 4 liters of pig fat during the twelfth lunar month. Boil to extract essence, add white atractylodes and yellow complex, strain, and apply to the area for immediate healing.

Another Recipe: Treats the same symptoms as above.

Ingredients:

  • 100 grams of licorice
  • 100 grams of common angelica
  • 100 grams of white atractylodes
  • 100 grams of fresh Cistanche (washed)
  • 100 grams of Sichuan pepper
  • 100 grams of Chinese wild ginger
  • 20 stalks of Chinese scallion
  • 150 grams of dry Rehmannia
  • 50 grams of snake’s venom

Preparation: Take the ten ingredients, crush them, soak in 250 grams of vinegar for one night, then add 3 kilograms of pig fat, boil until bubbling, apply three times up and down, and the ointment will be ready for immediate healing.[86p]

　　猬皮散　治痈疽脓血诸漏坏败，男发背，女乳房及五痔。　　刺猬皮　露蜂房各一具　地榆　附子　桂心　当归　续断各五分　厚朴六分　干姜　蜀椒　槁本各四分　　右十一味，治下筛，空腹以酒服方寸匕，日三，取瘥。加螌蝥七枚，益良。　　又方　治发背，背上初欲结肿。

　　大黄　升麻　黄芩　甘草各三两　栀子三七枚　　右五味，(口父)咀，以水九升，煮取三升，分三服。取快利便止，不利更进。
　　内补散　治痈疽发背已溃，排脓生肉。　　当归身　桂心各二两　人参　芎藭　厚朴　防风　甘草　白芷　桔梗各一两　　右九味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，日三夜二。未瘥更服勿绝。《外台》无防风、甘草、白芷。　　又方　治痈疽发背。

Hedgehog Skin Powder: Treats abscesses, sores, and various purulent and blood conditions, as well as male back issues, female breast problems, and hemorrhoids. Ingredients include one piece each of hedgehog skin and bee honeycomb, five grams each of earth yam, aconite, cassia heart, angelica, and rat tail, six grams of magnolia bark, and four grams each of dried ginger, Sichuan pepper, and dried root. Take this combination of eleven ingredients on an empty stomach with a small spoonful of wine, three times a day, until healing occurs. If seven centipedes are added, it is even more beneficial.

Another formula for treating back issues when initial swelling begins:

Three taels each of rhubarb, and stem of bulrush, three to seven pieces of gardenia fruit. Grind these five ingredients and decoct in nine liters of water until three liters remain, divided into three doses. It effectively facilitates bowel movements. If there is no improvement, continue treatment.

Internal Reinforcement Powder: Treats abscesses that have ruptured, draining pus and promoting flesh regeneration. Ingredients include two taels each of angelica and cassia heart, one tael each of ginseng, ligusticum, magnolia bark, saposhnikovia, licorice, white atractylodes, and balloon flower. Take this nine-ingredient combination on an empty stomach with a small spoonful of wine, three times a day and twice at night. Continue until healed; if not healed yet, do not stop taking it. The "Wai Tai" formula does not include saposhnikovia, licorice, or white atractylodes.

Another formula for treating abscesses:

Two fen each of Sichuan pepper, dried ginger, yellow gentian, and ginseng, one fen of cassia heart, one and a half doses of adzuki beans, two taels of ligusticum, and one tael each of white radish, licorice, aconite, and saposhnikovia. Take this eleven-ingredient combination on an empty stomach with a small spoonful of wine, three times a day and twice at night.[87p]

　　李根皮散　治痈疽发背，及少小瘰疬。　　李根皮一升　(艹舌)蒌根　半夏各五两　通草　白蔹　桔梗　厚朴　黄芩　白附子各一两　甘草　当归各二两　葛根三两　芎藭六两　桂心　芍药各四两　　右十五味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，日三。疮大困者，夜再服之。曾有人患骨从疮中出，兼有三十余痈疖，服此散瘥。
　　大内塞排脓散　治发背痈疽经年，瘥后复发，此因大风或结气在内，经脉闭塞，至夏月已来，出攻于背，久不治，积聚作脓血，为疮内漏。　　山茱萸　五味子　茯苓　干姜各六两　甘草　石斛　人参　桂心　芍药各五分　巴戟天　麦门冬　干地黄　苁蓉　远志各八分　当归　石韦　芎藭各四分　附子　地胆　菟丝各三分　　右二十味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，日三服，夜一服，稍加之。长服，终身不患痈疖。[88p]

Li Gen Pi San treats carbuncles and sores on the back, as well as children’s scrofula.

Ingredients:

  • 1 sheng of Li Gen Pi
  • 5 liang each of (Caohua) Lou Gen and Ban Xia
  • 1 liang each of Tong Cao, Bai Lian, Ju Ping, Hou Po, Huang Qin, and Bai Fu Zi
  • 2 liang each of Gan Cao and Dang Gui
  • 3 liang of Ge Gen
  • 6 liang of Xiong Dan
  • 4 liang each of Gui Xin and Shao Yao

Mix these fifteen ingredients, and take with wine, about a spoonful, three times a day. For large and troublesome sores, take again at night. There was a case in which bones protruded from a sore and over thirty carbuncles were present; after taking this powder, the patient recovered.

Da Nei Se Pai Nuan San is for treating chronic carbuncles on the back that recur after healing, often caused by strong winds or internal stagnation. If left untreated during the summer months, they can become abscesses filled with pus and blood leaking from the sores.

Ingredients:

  • 6 liang each of Shan Zhu Yu, Wu Wei Zi, Fu Ling, and Gan Jiang
  • 5 fen each of Gan Cao, Shi Hu, Ren Shen, Gui Xin, and Shao Yao
  • 8 fen each of Ba Ji Tian, Mai Men Dong, Gan Di Huang, Cong Rong, and Yuan Zhi
  • 4 fen each of Dang Gui, Shi Wei, and Xiong Dan
  • 3 fen each of Fu Zi, Di Dan, and Tu Si

Mix these twenty ingredients, take with wine, about a spoonful, three times a day and once at night, gradually increasing the dosage. Long-term use will prevent the development of carbuncles.[88p]

　　漏芦汤　治痈疽发背，初觉一二日，便如伤寒，头痛烦渴，拘急恶寒，肢体疼痛，四肢沉重，恍惚闷乱，坐卧不宁，皮肤壮热，大便秘濇，小便赤黄，并宜服之。姙娠莫服。　　漏芦　白蔹　黄芩　麻黄　枳实麸炒，去瓤　升麻　芍药　甘草炙　(石卜)硝各一两　大黄二两　　右除硝外，余(口父)咀与硝同和匀，每服三钱，气实人五钱，水一盏半，文武火煎七沸，去滓，空心热服。
　　五利大黄汤　治人年四十已前，气血盛多，若患疮疽，大小便秘。　　大黄根　黄芩去黑腐　升麻各一两　芒硝　栀子各一两二钱　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水一盏，煎五七沸，去滓，空心稍热服。
　　托里散　治痈疽发背，脓成败溃者。　　川乌头炮　茯苓各三两　干姜炮　麻黄去节　甘草炙，各一两五钱　杏仁炒，去皮尖　五味子　桂心各一两　　右为粗末，每服五六钱，水一盏半，煎至一盏，去滓，食前温服。[89p]

Loulu Decoction: Treats boils and carbuncles on the back that begin with initial symptoms like those of a cold—headache, thirst, chills, body aches, heaviness in the limbs, confusion, restlessness, hot skin, constipation, and reddish-yellow urine. It is suitable for consumption. Not to be used during pregnancy. Ingredients: LuLu (Lophatherum gracile), Bailian (Radix et Rhizoma et al.), Huangqin (Scutellaria baicalensis), Mahuang (Ephedra sinica), Zhi Shi (Citri Auranti Fructus) toasted and the core removed, Shengma (Cimicifuga), Shaoyao (Paeonia lactiflora), Gan Cao (Glycyrrhiza uralensis) roasted, Sheliang (Mineral salts) each 1 liang; Dahuang (Rhubarb) 2 liang. Except for the Sheliang, the rest should be ground and mixed uniformly with the Sheliang. Take 3 qian per dose; for those with a strong constitution, 5 qian. Use 1.5 bowls of water, boil with moderate heat until it has boiled 7 times, strain, and take on an empty stomach while hot.

Wuli Dahuang Decoction: Treats individuals under 40 years of age with excess energy and blood who suffer from sores or carbuncles with constipation in both large and small intestines. Ingredients: Dahuang root, Huangqin (removing blackened parts), Shengma each 1 liang; Mangxiao (magnesium sulfate), Zhizi (Gardenia fruit) each 1 liang and 2 qian. Grind together, take 5 qian per dose; boil with 1 bowl of water until it has boiled 5 to 7 times, strain and take warm on an empty stomach.

Tuoli Powder: Treats boils and carbuncles on the back, especially when pus has formed and is about to rupture. Ingredients: Chuanwu (Aconitum) prepared, Fuling (Poria) each 3 liang; dried ginger, Mahuang (with joints removed), Gan Cao roasted, each 1 liang and 5 qian; Xingren (Apricot kernel) roasted (skin and tip removed), Wuweizi (Schisandra) and Guixin (Cinnamon) each 1 liang. Grind into a coarse powder, take 5 to 6 qian per dose; use 1.5 bowls of water, simmer until down to 1 bowl, strain, and take warm before meals.[89p]

内托里散: For treating carbuncles and tumors that arise on the back, especially for those with internal deficiency after bursting, or for individuals with weak qi who first experience sores or abscesses, it can also be taken for internal resolution; detailed usage is advised.

当归托里汤: For treating carbuncles and tumors on the back, especially when pus has formed and is ready to burst.

翠霞散: For treating carbuncles and tumors on the back, to detoxify and promote flesh regeneration.
Ingredients:

Collection of Ancient and Modern Literature: Complete Compilation of Medical Sections, Volume 177

Spinal Door

Formulas

Frankincense Powder – Treats back pain.
Ingredients:

  • White dried ginger: 5 qian
  • Bittersweet clove: 5 qian
  • Aconite root: 5 qian
  • Codonopsis root: 1 liang
  • Wolf poison: 1 liang
  • Frankincense: 1 liang

Grind all into a fine powder. Each time, apply it dry; alternatively, mix with saliva to form pills and insert them into the wound.

Pursue Poison Powder – Also known as Pursue Poison Pill. Treats carbuncles and boils on the back, when pus does not drain quickly.
Ingredients:

  • Five-spice resin: 1 liang
  • Processed aconite: 1 liang
  • Processed white dried ginger: 1 liang
  • Scorpion: 5 qian

Grind all into a fine powder. Take a small amount and apply it inside the wound; for deeper wounds, use a paper twist dipped in the medicine and insert it into the wound, applying an ointment on top; alternatively, soak a pancake, allow it to penetrate, remove the water, mix with the medicine and form small pills, inserting them into the wound each time.

Detoxification Pill – Treats all initial signs of swelling and toxins, cough, discomfort, or constriction in the throat, along with fever and chills after one or two days.
Ingredients:

  • Frankincense (ground separately): 5 qian
  • Myrrh (ground separately): 5 qian
  • Aconite (pickled and toasted): 7 qian
  • Calcined pumice: 7 qian
  • Castor bean (49 seeds, peeled and used raw, ground separately):

Grind all ingredients into a fine powder. Use pumice and aconite, mix with the remaining vinegar to form a dough for pills, about the size of peas. Take 5 to 7 pills with cold wine after meals. Avoid hot drinks. Expect swift results in two to three actions, or expel harmful substances as an effect.[91p]

　　保生挺子　治疔疮背疽瘰疬一切恶疮。　　金脚信　雄黄　轻粉　硇砂各二钱　麝一钱　巴豆四十九粒，文武火炒，研　　右为极细末，用黄蜡五钱熔开，将药和成挺子，冷水浸，少时取出，旋丸捏作饼子如钱眼大，将疮头拨开，安一饼子，次用神圣膏贴，后服托里散。若疮气入腹危者，服破棺丹。
　　神圣膏　治发背痈疽一切恶疮。
　　当归　槁本各半两　没药研　乳香研，各二钱　琥珀二钱五分　黄丹　黄蜡　白胶香各二两　胆矾　粉霜各一钱　槐枝柳枝各一百廿条　木鳖子去皮，五十个　巴豆仁十五个　清油二斤　　右作一处，先将槐枝柳枝下油内熬焦，取出不用；后下余药，熬至焦黑，亦漉出不用；将油澄清，下黄丹再熬成膏，用绯帛摊之，甚效。[92p]

Bao Sheng Tiao Zi: Treats carbuncles, boils, and all kinds of foul sores.

Ingredients:

  • Gold foot powder
  • Realgar
  • Talc
  • Sand ($2$ qian each)
  • Musk ($1$ qian)
  • Forty-nine kernels of croton; stir-fried with medium and high heat, then ground into a very fine powder.

Mix $5$ qian of yellow wax until melted, combine with the powder to form a paste. Soak in cold water for a while, then take out, shape into small cakes the size of a coin. Open the sore, apply one cake, followed by a Sacred Plaster, and take the Tuoli Powder orally. If the sore's poison has entered the abdomen and is serious, take the Poke the Coffin Pill.

Sacred Plaster: Treats back sores, boils, and all kinds of foul sores.

Ingredients:

  • Angelica and dry roots (each $0.5$ taels)
  • Ground myrrh and ground frankincense ($2$ qian each)
  • Amber (2.5 qian)
  • Yellow lead, yellow wax, white aromatic resin ($2$ taels each)
  • Copper vitriol and powdered frost ($1$ qian each)
  • $120$ twigs of locust and willow
  • $50$ stripped seeds of wood-bitter
  • $15$ kernels of croton
  • $2$ jin of raw oil

Preparation: Combine all ingredients, first frying the locust and willow twigs in oil until charred, then removing them. Add the remaining ingredients and cook until charred and blackened, then strain and discard the solids. Clarify the oil, add yellow lead, and reboil into a paste, then spread on crimson cloth for effective use.[92p]

　　金银花散 【 《卫生宝鉴》】 　治发背恶疮，托里止痛排脓。　　金银花四两　甘草炒一两
　　右为粗末，每服四钱，水酒各一盏，煎至一盏，去滓热服之。

Honeysuckle Powder
To treat abscesses on the back, relieving pain and expelling pus.
Four taels of honeysuckle, one tael of stir-fried licorice.
Grind these into a coarse powder. Take four qian each time, mix in one cup of water and one cup of wine, boil down to one cup, strain and take hot.

Death-Defying Pill
To treat abscesses and boils on the back.
Fresh rhubarb ground into powder, placed in a sand pot, stirred with water eighty-one times, added with one tael each of dried oyster and ginger, and one qian each of myrrh and frankincense.
Grind into a coarse powder and shape into pills. Take one qian, mix with one liter of good wine, boil over charcoal until it steams, divide into two bowls, leave exposed overnight, strain in the morning and take on an empty stomach.

Huang Qin and Dong Quai Decoction
To treat back boils.
Seven qian of stir-fried Huang Qin, five fen of lian qiao, one tael each of stir-fried Huang Qin, stir-fried Dong Quai, and stir-fried licorice; five qian each of stir-fried Huang Lian and fang feng; three qian each of ze xie, shan zhi, zhi mu, and di gu pi.
Grind these together, divide into four doses, soak in a small bowl of water for a while, add one spoon of wine, boil down to eight parts, strain, and mix with betel nut powder, then take warm.

Five Spice Powder
To treat the imbalance of yin and yang, relieving stagnation, swelling pain, and cold and heat headaches on the back.
Equal parts of mu xiang, ding xiang, chen xiang, frankincense, and musk.
Grind into a coarse powder, take three qian each time, decoct in water to drink. If musk is unavailable, use huo xiang instead.[93p]

　　神异膏　治一切痈疽发背。
　　杏仁去皮尖，切片　露蜂房剪净，各一两，蜂多者妙　蛇蜕盐水洗净，焙干　元参各半两　黄芪三分　黄丹五两，研细　男子乱发洗净焙干，如鸡子大　真麻油一斤　　右件药，先将麻油入银铫内，同乱发于风炉上慢慢文武火熬，候发焦熔尽，以杏仁投入，候杏仁色变，以好绵滤去滓；再将所熬清油，入银铫内，然后入黄芪、元参二味，慢火熬一二时，取出铫子，安一冷风炉上，候半时久，火力稍息，旋入露蜂房、蛇蜕二味，将柳枝急搅，移铫于火上，不住手搅，慢火熬至黄紫色，用绵滤过后，复入清油在铫内，乘冷投黄丹急搅，片时又移铫于火上，文武火慢慢熬不住手，用柳枝搅千余转，候药油变黑色，滴于水中，凝结成珠子，则是膏成就矣。[95p]

To prepare the remedy, first grind the ingredients evenly and cover the affected area with a piece of blue silk. If it appears dry, moisten it with fresh well water, keeping it consistently damp, which will naturally disperse the heat and toxins. If heat and toxins are attacking a lump, this can be used; if it is an energy blockage, do not use this method.

Shen Yi Ointment – Treats all kinds of carbuncles and furuncles.

Take one liang of peeled and sliced apricot kernel, one liang of cleaned bee's nest, and the more bees, the better. Clean and dry one liang of snake’s skin washed in salt water. Take half a liang each of original root and astragalus, three fen of astragalus, and five liang of yellow lead, finely ground. The messy hair of a man, cleaned and dried, about the size of a chicken egg, uses one jin of real hemp oil.

For preparation: first, place the hemp oil in a silver mortar, mix it with the messy hair, and slowly simmer it over a gentle flame until the hair is charred and completely melted. When this happens, add in the apricot kernels and wait for them to change color. Then filter the oil through fine cotton to remove any residue. Next, put the strained oil back into the silver mortar and add the two herbs, original root and astragalus, simmering them over a low fire for one to two hours. Remove the mortar and place it on a cool hearth, waiting for about half an hour until the heat subsides. Then quickly add the cleaned bee's nest and snake’s skin, and stir with a willow branch while keeping the mortar over the fire, constantly stirring until it reaches a yellow-purple color. After filtering again through cotton, pour in the clean oil and rapidly mix in the yellow lead. Then return the mortar to the fire, stirring constantly over a low flame until the oil turns black. When droplets fall into water and form beads, the ointment is complete.[95p]

若珠子稀，再熬少时，必候得所。然后用磁器内封收待用。或恐偶然熬火太过，稍硬难用，却入少蜡熬，添麻油在内，磁器盛封盖，于甑上蒸，乘热搅匀，收而用之。膏药熬成了，须用所盛磁器，置净水盆中，出火毒一昼夜，歇三日方可用。熬此膏药，极难于火候，须耐烦看火紧慢，火猛即药中火发，千万谨戒！膏药方甚多，－效者无出于此。[96p]

If the paste is scarce, simmer for a little longer, and it will be ready. Then use a ceramic container to seal and store it for future use. If there is a concern that it may have been overheated and becomes too hard to use, add a little wax and mix in sesame oil, placing it in a ceramic container to steam over boiling water, stirring well while hot, and then store it. Once the ointment is completed, it is essential to place the ceramic container in a basin of clean water to draw out the harmful heat for a full day and rest for three days before it can be used. The process of preparing this ointment is very sensitive to the temperature; one must patiently monitor the heat carefully, as too strong a fire will cause the paste to overheat—this precaution is paramount! The formula for the ointment is numerous, but those that are effective are unmatched by this one.[96p]

Bī Dú Sǎn (Poison Dispersing Powder)

For abscesses on the back where the pus has been fully expelled, the skin is adhered on all sides, and there is concern that the pus and toxins may re-emerge, it is advisable to use this medicine.

Ingredients:

  • Ground Realgar: 1 qian (about 3 grams)
  • Yellow Medicine: 1 liang (about 30 grams)
  • White Medicine: 1 liang (about 30 grams)
  • Red Beans: 2 liang (about 60 grams)

Mix these into a powder and apply with water.

Qīng Sǎn Zǐ (Green Powder for Abscesses)

For treating abscesses on the back where the pus has been fully expelled and new flesh is being generated, this powder is suitable as it encourages skin growth around the wound.

Ingredients:

  • Hibiscus Leaves (harvested when abundant), dried: 4 liang (about 120 grams)
  • Green Beans: 2 liang (about 60 grams)
  • Red Beans: 2 liang (about 60 grams)
  • White Achyranthes: 2 liang (about 60 grams)

Mix these ingredients into a powder. For immediate use, take 3 qian of hibiscus powder, 1 qian of white achyranthes and red bean powder, mix together, and adjust with freshly drawn water. Spread it on paper to adhere to the sides, avoiding the center of the wound.

Hé Qì Sǎn (Harmonizing Powder)

For treating all types of abscesses on the back after pus has burst, with symptoms of qi deficiency and spleen dampness leading to cold extremities.

Ingredients:

  • Atractylodes (Cāngzhú): 4 liang (about 120 grams), soaked in rice wash for a day, cleaned, dried, and then stir-fried with rice vinegar until fragrant and yellow.
  • Licorice (Gāncǎo): 1 liang (about 30 grams), roasted
  • Citrus Peel (Qīngpí): 1 liang (about 30 grams), pith removed
  • Galangal (Liángjiāng): 0.5 liang (about 15 grams), stir-fried
  • Cinnamon (Ròuguì): 0.5 liang (about 15 grams)
  • Dried Ginger (Gānjiāng): 0.5 liang (about 15 grams), prepared
  • Aged Millet (Chén sù): 0.5 sheng (about 1 liter)

Mix these seven ingredients into a powder. Take 1 qian (about 3 grams) per dose, mix with 0.5 qian of roasted fennel powder, adjust with warm wine, and consume at any time.[97p]

Method of the Immortals

To treat abscesses and all kinds of poisonous sores, preemptive use prevents toxins from entering the body.

Take one pound of true sesame oil, heat it in a silver vessel until it boils several times, then let it cool.

Next, take two bowls of wine and combine with five cups of oil. Consume it hot through the mouth, finishing it in one day; if slow, take it over several days.

Wu Anshi stated: "My family has used this for three generations, and it has never failed." It is also said by hunters: "If you are hit by a medicinal arrow, urgently take sesame oil, and the poison will dissipate." Zheng Xue argues that De Fu's repeated use of it has shown remarkable efficacy.

Sesame oil clears heat and toxins from the lower energizers and relieves gas stagnation in the large and small intestines. If sores begin to develop with toxins accumulating inside, or if constipation occurs, using it to facilitate detoxification is indeed a good method. However, if constipation is not present and there is excessive heat in the lower energizers, it may not be appropriate; one should examine the condition carefully before use.
